title: Cindy (film)
text:
Cindy is a 1978 <a href="Cinema%20of%20the%20United%20States">American</a> <a href="Musical%20film">musical</a> <a href="television%20film">television film</a> that features an entirely <a href="African-American">African-American</a> cast. Directed by <a href="William%20A.%20Graham%20%28director%29">William A. Graham</a>, the film is an urbanized retelling of "<a href="Cinderella">Cinderella</a>".
Plot.
After <a href="World%20War%20II">World War II</a>, Cindy (Woodard) has moved from the <a href="Southern%20United%20States">south</a> to live in <a href="Harlem">Harlem</a> with her newly <a href="Stepfamily">blended family</a>. She finds herself constantly abused by her stepmother and stepsisters. Her father (Mitchell) provides some comfort but cannot prevent the abuse entirely. One night, she meets Captain Joe Prince (Davis) and is swept off her feet. Soon after, a romance ensues.
